abstract: Two new shows with similar themes, one on ABC and the other on NBC, seem to be attracting attention so far.
snippet: Two new shows with similar themes, one on ABC and the other on NBC, seem to be attracting attention so far.
lead_paragraph: It appears that the viewing public has fallen under the spell of not one but two fairy-tale-centric dramas. "Once Upon a Time" on ABC on Sunday night held on to its impressive premiere numbers: it fell slightly in total viewers to 11.64 million, but retained 100 percent of its premiere 18-to-49-year-old audience. Two nights earlier, despite competing against Game 7 of the World Series, the premiere of NBC's "Grimm" was sampled by 6.5 million total viewers. It was also the highest-rated Friday nonsports telecast in the 18-to-49 category from any network since Dec. 31, 2010.
